user signs a merkle root (tree of operation digests) with their passkey.      Each operation provides a merkle proof showing its digest is a leaf in the tree.      When proofLength = 0, falls back to regular signing (user signs digest directly).      Supports multiple passkeys via 2-byte keyIds; any single credential can sign.      KNOWN SECURITY CONSIDERATIONS:      Recovery supports in-place rotation: When replace is true in the recovery struct,      the credential at keyId has its public key overwritten in-place. When replace is      false, recovery is additive (new credential added, existing keys remain).      Guardian timelock: Guardian changes support an optional timelock via setUserGuardian()      and setExternalGuardian(). When guardianTimelock is zero (the default), changes take      effect immediately. When non-zero and a guardian of that type already exists, changes      are queued and must be confirmed via confirmGuardian() after the timelock elapses.      Initial guardian set (no existing guardian of that type) is always immediate.      Cross-chain merkle signing requires same contract address: _passkeyMultichain() uses      _hashTypedDataSansChainId which omits chainId but still includes verifyingContract in      the EIP-712 domain separator. The module must be deployed at the same address on all      target chains (e.g., via CREATE2) for cross-chain signatures to verify.","kind":"dev","methods":{"addCredential(uint16,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"msg.sender is the smart account calling this function directly (not via entrypoint). NOTE: Unlike the stateful validation paths (validateUserOp, isValidSignatureWithSender)      which return false/VALIDATION_FAILED on invalid input per ERC-4337, this function REVERTS      on malformed input (InvalidSignatureData, ProofTooLong, InvalidMerkleProof). addCredential(uint16,bytes32,bytes32).details: msg.sender is the smart account calling this function directly (not via entrypoint).      The module must already be installed (isInitialized check in _addCredential), preventing      credentials from being added before onInstall establishes the account's credential set.

params.pubKeyX: X coordinate of the P-256 public key (validated to be on curve)
params.pubKeyY: Y coordinate of the P-256 public key (validated to be on curve)

returns._0: The count of currently registered credentials

getCredential(uint16,address).details: Returns (0, 0) if the credential does not exist.

params.account: The smart account address that owns the credential

returns.pubKeyX: X coordinate of the P-256 public key (bytes32(0) if not found)
returns.pubKeyY: Y coordinate of the P-256 public key (bytes32(0) if not found)

getPasskeyDigest(bytes32).details: Public convenience wrapper around _passkeyDigest for off-chain tooling to compute      the exact challenge bytes the passkey must sign for regular (non-merkle) operations.

returns._0: The EIP-712 typed data hash to be used as the WebAuthn challenge

getPasskeyMultichain(bytes32).details: Public convenience wrapper around _passkeyMultichain for off-chain tooling to      compute the exact challenge bytes the passkey must sign for merkle batch operations.

params.root: The merkle root of the operation digest tree

returns._0: The chain-agnostic EIP-712 typed data hash to be used as the WebAuthn challenge

getRecoverDigest(address,uint256,(uint16.details: Uses `_hashTypedDataSansChainId` (chain-agnostic domain separator) so the domain      does NOT include chainId. Instead, chainId is embedded in the struct hash.

isInitialized(address).details: An account is considered initialized if it has at least one credential registered.      Since onInstall requires at least one credential and removeCredential prevents      removing the last one, a zero count means never installed or fully uninstalled.

params.smartAccount: The smart account address to check

returns._0: True if the account has at least one registered credential

params.typeID: The ERC-7579 module type identifier to check

returns._0: True if this module supports the given type

isValidSignatureWithSender(address,bytes.details: The first parameter (sender) is intentionally ignored. Per ERC-7579, the smart      account calls this function on the validator module, so msg.sender IS the smart      account and is used as the account for credential lookup. The sender parameter      (which would be the original caller of the smart account's isValidSignature)      is not relevant for credential-based validation.

params.data: The packed signature data (same format as userOp.signature)
params.hash: The hash of the data to validate

returns._0: bytes4 EIP1271_SUCCESS (0x1626ba7e) if valid, EIP1271_FAILED (0xffffffff) otherwise

onInstall(bytes).details: Called by the smart account during module installation (ERC-7579 lifecycle).      msg.sender is the smart account itself, not an EOA or external caller.

params.data: abi.encode(uint16[] keyIds, WebAuthnCredential[] creds, address userGuardian, address externalGuardian, uint48 guardianTimelock)

onUninstall(bytes).details: Called by the smart account during module removal (ERC-7579 lifecycle).      msg.sender is the smart account. Iterates all enabled credKeys, deletes each      credential's public key data, removes it from the enumerable set, and clears      the guardian address.      NOTE: Used recovery nonces (in _recoveryConfig[account].nonceUsed) are intentionally      NOT cleared. This prevents replay attacks where a previously-used recovery signature      could be replayed after reinstalling the module.

returns.activatesAt: Timestamp when the change can be confirmed (0 if none)
returns.isExternal: Whether the pending change is for the external guardian
returns.pendingGuardian: The proposed guardian address (address(0) if none)

recoverWithGuardian(address,uint256,(uin.details: Callable by anyone (permissionless). The first byte of `guardianSig` selects the      guardian type: `0x00` for user guardian, `0x01` for external guardian. The remaining      bytes are the actual signature passed to `SignatureCheckerLib`.

recoverWithPasskey(address,uint256,(uint.details: Callable by anyone (permissionless) -- security relies entirely on the cryptographic      verification of the existing passkey's signature over the EIP-712 recovery digest.

removeCredential(uint16).details: msg.sender is the smart account calling this function directly. Prevents removing      the last credential to maintain a liveness guarantee -- the account must always      have at least one credential capable of signing to avoid permanent lockout.

params.keyId: 16-bit identifier of the credential to remove

setExternalGuardian(address).details: Initial set (when no external guardian exists) takes effect immediately regardless of      timelock. Subsequent changes are subject to the timelock if configured.      A new proposal overwrites any existing pending guardian change (of either type).

setUserGuardian(address).details: Initial set (when no user guardian exists) takes effect immediately regardless of      timelock. Subsequent changes are subject to the timelock if configured.      A new proposal overwrites any existing pending guardian change (of either type).

validateSignatureWithData(bytes32,bytes,.details: Unlike the stateful validateUserOp / isValidSignatureWithSender paths, this function      does not look up credentials by account. Instead, the caller provides the public key      and validation parameters in `data`, and the WebAuthn signature in `signature`.      This enables off-chain verifiers to validate signatures without the module being installed.      NOTE: Unlike the stateful validation paths (validateUserOp, isValidSignatureWithSender)      which return false/VALIDATION_FAILED on invalid input per ERC-4337, this function REVERTS      on malformed input (InvalidSignatureData, ProofTooLong, InvalidMerkleProof). It only      returns false for valid-format-but-wrong-signature cases (when WebAuthn.verify fails).      The `data` layout mirrors the stateful signature format (proof before credential data):        [0]       proofLength (uint8)        if proofLength == 0 (regular signing, challenge = _passkeyDigest(hash)):          [1:33]                         pubKeyX          [33:65]                        pubKeyY        if proofLength > 0 (merkle proof, challenge = _passkeyMultichain(merkleRoot)):          [1:33]                         merkleRoot (bytes32)          [33:33+proofLength*32]         proof (bytes32[])          [proofEnd:proofEnd+32]         pubKeyX          [proofEnd+32:proofEnd+64]      pubKeyY      `signature` is packed WebAuthnAuth (see P256Lib.parseWebAuthnAuth for format).

params.data: Packed credential and proof data as described above
params.hash: The digest to validate (or a leaf in the merkle tree for batch signing)
params.signature: Packed WebAuthnAuth struct (r, s, challengeIndex, typeIndex, authenticatorData, clientDataJSON)

returns._0: True if the signature is valid for the provided credentials

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.details: The account address is userOp.sender, NOT msg.sender (msg.sender is the EntryPoint).      Returns VALIDATION_SUCCESS (0) if the signature is valid, or VALIDATION_FAILED (1)      otherwise. Must never revert per ERC-4337 spec -- all failure cases return      VALIDATION_FAILED instead.

params.userOp: The packed user operation containing the signature in userOp.signature
params.userOpHash: The hash of the user operation (used as the digest to verify)

addCredential(uint16,bytes32,bytes32).notice: Add a new credential with a specific keyId

confirmGuardian().notice: Confirm a pending guardian change after the timelock has elapsed

credentialCount(address).notice: Get the number of credentials for an account

externalGuardian(address).notice: Returns the external guardian address configured for an account

getCredKeys(address).notice: Get all enabled credential keys for an account

getCredential(uint16,address).notice: Get the P-256 public key coordinates for a specific credential

getPasskeyDigest(bytes32).notice: Compute the passkey challenge for a single operation digest (chain-specific)

getPasskeyMultichain(bytes32).notice: Compute the passkey challenge for a merkle root (chain-agnostic)

getRecoverDigest(address,uint256,(uint16.notice: Computes the EIP-712 recovery digest for off-chain or on-chain verification

guardianTimelock(address).notice: Returns the guardian timelock duration for an account

isInitialized(address).notice: Check whether the module is installed for a given smart account

isModuleType(uint256).notice: ERC-7579 module type check -- reports this module as both a standard validator         (TYPE_VALIDATOR) and a stateless validator (TYPE_STATELESS_VALIDATOR)

isValidSignatureWithSender(address,bytes.notice: EIP-1271 signature validation (called by the smart account)

nonceUsed(address,uint256).notice: Checks whether a specific recovery nonce has been consumed for an account

onInstall(bytes).notice: Install the module with initial credentials, optional guardians, and optional timelock

onUninstall(bytes).notice: Uninstall the module, clearing all credentials and guardian

recoverWithGuardian(address,uint256,(uin.notice: Recovers an account by adding or replacing a credential, authorized by a guardian

recoverWithPasskey(address,uint256,(uint.notice: Recovers an account by adding or replacing a credential, authorized by an existing passkey

setExternalGuardian(address).notice: Set or change the external guardian for the caller's account

setGuardianTimelock(uint48).notice: Set the guardian timelock duration for the caller's account

setUserGuardian(address).notice: Set or change the user guardian for the caller's account

userGuardian(address).notice: Returns the user guardian address configured for an account

validateSignatureWithData(bytes32,bytes,.notice: ERC-7579 stateless validation extension -- credentials are provided externally         in `data` rather than fetched from on-chain storage

validateUserOp((address,uint256,bytes,by.notice: ERC-4337 user operation validation (called by the EntryPoint)
